To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, <FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.<RF>overwhelmed: Heb. covered<Rf>
And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! <FI>for then<Fi> would I fly away, and be at rest.
Lo, <FI>then<Fi> would I wander far off, <FI>and<Fi> remain in the wilderness. Selah.
I would hasten my escape from the windy storm <FI>and<Fi> tempest.<CM>
Destroy, O Lord, <FI>and<Fi> divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow <FI>are<Fi> in the midst of it.
Wickedness <FI>is<Fi> in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

For <FI>it was<Fi> not an enemy <FI>that<Fi> reproached me; then I could have borne <FI>it<Fi>: neither <FI>was it<Fi> he that hated me <FI>that<Fi> did magnify <FI>himself<Fi> against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
But <FI>it was<Fi> thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.<RF>mine equal: Heb. according to my rank<Rf>
We took sweet counsel together, <FI>and<Fi> walked unto the house of God in company.<RF>We…: Heb. Who sweetened counsel<Rf>
Let death seize upon them, <FI>and<Fi> let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness <FI>is<Fi> in their dwellings, <FI>and<Fi> among them.<RF>hell: or, the grave<Rf><CM>
As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.
Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle <FI>that was<Fi> against me: for there were many with me.
God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.<RF>Because…: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they<Rf>
He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.<RF>broken: Heb. profaned<Rf>
<FI>The words<Fi> of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war <FI>was<Fi> in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet <FI>were<Fi> they drawn swords.
Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.<RF>burden: or, gift<Rf>

But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.<RF>bloody…: Heb. men of bloods and deceit<Rf><RF>shall…: Heb. shall not half their days<Rf><CM>
